comments:
Returns an exog array with correlations determined by cor_length. The covariance matrix of exog will have (asymptotically, as :math:'N\to\inf') .. math:: Cov[i,j] = \exp(-|i-j| / cor_length)

Higher cor_length makes the problem more ill-posed, and easier to screw up with noise. BEWARE:

With very long correlation lengths, you often get a singular KKT matrix (during the l1_cvxopt_cp fit)
